titles: To a vertuous and judicious lady who (for the exercise of her devotion) built a closet, wherein to secure the most sacred Booke of Common-Prayer, from the view and violence of the enemies thereof, the sectaries and schismatiques of this kingdome. / Written by a most orthodox, moderate, and judicious divine, a banished minister of this miserable kingdome.
notes: Verse - "Since it hath pleas'd our wife and new-born State"...
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Church of England. --  Book of Common Prayer --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Religious aspects --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
